topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Creating a StoreVirtual Cluster and Adding to a Management Group

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Creating a StoreVirtual Cluster and Adding it to a New Management Group

body.p: After HP StoreVirtual Storage systems are deployed, you must create clusters and add the clusters to a management group.
Before starting, make sure the following tasks have been completed.

ul.li: HP StoreVirtual VSA (one or more) is deployed in the same management network where CMC is installed.

section.title: Creating a cluster and management group
section.p: You can create a new management group where you can add a new cluster.
To create a cluster, do the following:

li.p: Open CMC.
By default, the CMC is configured to discover the StoreVirtual nodes in the subnet in which it is installed. You can manually add the nodes also.
Click to view larger image; click Back to return.
In the CMC UI, click Find and then click Find Systems from the left panel. Find Systems dialogue box is displayed.
Click to view larger image; click Back to return.

You can choose Add or Find option to search the system. Find option starts searching for the nodes in the same subnet as that of CMC. Add option displays an Enter IP pop-up box to enter the IP of the StoreVirtual system.

Note:To get the details of the HP StoreVirtual VSA IP, log in to StoreVirtual system and check /mnt/state/vsa/vsa_network_config.json file and select the second option, which is listed under "vsa network".
Click to view larger image; click Back to return.
Click to view larger image; click Back to return.
Click OK to proceed, or click Cancel to cancel the process.The node is discovered and the details are displayed in a tabular format in the Find Systems dialogue box.
(Optional) Click Add in the Find Systems dialogue box to add more nodes.
(Optional) Click Edit in the Find Systems dialogue box to modify the details of the selected node.
(Optional) Click Remove in the Find Systems box to delete a node.
Click Close to return to the Home page. The discovered nodes are displayed under Available Systems option in the left panel.
Click to view larger image; click Back to return.
To add the node to a management group, right-click the node to display a menu and select Add to a New Management Group. Management Groups, Clusters, And Volumes wizard is displayed.
Click to view larger image; click Back to return.
In the Management Group Name box, enter a name for the management group and click Next to display the Add Administrative User page.
Enter the required information for the Administrative user and click Next to display the Management Group Time page.
Synchronize the time manually or using an NTP server and click Next to display the Domain Name Server Configuration page.
Define DNS details and click Next to display the Email Notification Setup page and define SMTP details.
Note: It is optional to enter the details in the above step.
Click Next to display a Wizard in the Create a Cluster page.
Select the cluster type as Standard Cluster from the displayed options and click Next.
In the Cluster Name box, enter the name of the cluster and click Next.
In the Add VIP and Subnet Mask pop-up box, enter the virtual IP and Subnet Mask of the cluster in the respective boxes and click OK. The details are displayed in a tabular format in the page.
Note: Ensure that the Virtual IP (VIP) is unique and is in the same subnet as the HP StoreVirtual VSA system.
Click Next to go to the next page.
(Optional) Click the checkbox displayed against Skip Volume Creation.
Click Next.The Management Group and Cluster is created and displays in the Home page of CMC.
Click to view larger image; click Back to return.

section.title: Adding HP StoreVirtual VSA System to an existing Management Group
section.p: To add a StoreVirtual system to any existing Management Group, do the following:

li.p: Open CMC.
By default, the CMC is configured to discover the HP StoreVirtual VSA systems in the subnet on which it is installed. You can manually add the nodes also.
In the CMC page, click Find Systems from the left panel. Find Systems dialogue box is displayed with an Enter IP pop-up box.
You can choose Add or Find option to search the system. Find option starts searching for the nodes in the subnet. Add option displays an Enter IP pop-up box to enter the IP of the StoreVirtual node.
Click OK to proceed or click Cancel to cancel the process.The node is discovered and the details are displayed in a tabular format in the Find Systems dialogue box.
(Optional) Click Add in the Find Systems dialogue box to add more nodes.
(Optional) Click Edit in the Find Systems dialogue box to modify the details of the selected node.
(Optional) Click Remove in the Find Systems box to delete a node.
Click Close to return to the Home page. The discovered nodes are displayed under Available Systems option in the left panel.
Right-click the node to display a menu and select Add to an Existing Management Group.
Enter the name of the management group.
Click Add to add the node to the group that you specified. The node is added to the management group.
